channel.title: 2025s auf Nicky Reinert
channel.description: Blog & projects by Nicky Reinert (Institute for Digital Challenges): web development & software development, SEO & analytics, hosting & DevOps, WordPress & Hugo, tools & projects, data protection & digital culture — plus content on AI and autism & society.

item.title: AI assisted coding - the plAIbook
item.description: Famous first words I work extensively with AI, and as it is a new tool that introduces an entirely different way of working, it sometimes takes time to adapt to these new circumstances. In this context, I am still exploring the best approach to integrate AI or agentic chatbots into my development …

item.title: How to simulate proof of work in SQL and BigQuery
item.description: (or: How does blockchain mining work?) A miner has to solve a mathematical problem to validate a block for the Blockhain. item.title: wad - about chatbots, captchas, and Chromecast

item.title: My 2,718281828459045235 Cents - State Of AI: Year 3 of the hype. Things I learned.
item.description: What about coding People don’t get tired of announcing that AI will replace developers. Mostly salespeople. Microsoft claims that AI is already writing 30–50% of their code. They also admit, that quality of C+ is behind expectations. In 2030 they plan to reach a rate of 95%, though human oversight …

item.title: How to develop in 2025: Improve your Workflow with VS Code, GitHub & Copilot
item.description: VS Code Workspace Settings Shortcuts First of all, I strongly suggest adding some custom shortcuts because the default ones are a bit unintuitive. For example, CTRL + SHIFT + ' gets you to the terminal, while SHIFT + FN + F6 brings you back to the editor, andSHIFT + B opens the sidebar. What a mess! …
